intro: Chlorophytum decipiens, commonly known as the spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring long, arching leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow stripes. The plant produces small, fragrant, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by red berries containing seeds. It is well adapted to a variety of growing conditions and is popular as a houseplant due to its ease of care and aesthetic appeal.
